<!-- If you need help or think you have found a bug, please help us with your issue by entering the following information (otherwise you can delete this text): -->

Output of `helm version`:
```
$ helm3 version
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.0-alpha.2", GitCommit:"97e7461e41455e58d89b4d7d192fed5352001d44", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.12.7"}
```

Output of `kubectl version`:
N/A

Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.): 
N/A

When linting multiple charts in helm3 all error messages are merged together making it hard to work out which chart caused a failure.

```
$ mkdir -p /tmp/broken_chart_{1,2}
$ touch /tmp/broken_chart_1/Chart.yaml
$ helm3 lint /tmp/broken_chart*
Error: 1 chart(s) linted, 2 chart(s) failed
        %!s(<nil>)
        no chart found for linting (missing Chart.yaml)
        [ERROR] Chart.yaml: name is required
        [ERROR] Chart.yaml: directory name (broken_chart_1) and chart name () must be the same
        [ERROR] Chart.yaml: apiVersion is required. The value must be either "v1" or "v2"
        [ERROR] Chart.yaml: version is required
        [INFO] Chart.yaml: icon is recommended
        [INFO] values.yaml: file does not exist
        [WARNING] templates/: directory not found 
```

I'm not sure if this is the expected behavior of the lint action or not but this change makes it difficult to work out what failed compared to the same command in helm2.
```
$ helm lint /tmp/broken_chart*
==> Linting /tmp/broken_chart_1
[ERROR] Chart.yaml: name is required
[ERROR] Chart.yaml: directory name (broken_chart_1) and chart name () must be the same
[ERROR] Chart.yaml: version is required
[INFO] Chart.yaml: icon is recommended
[INFO] values.yaml: file does not exist
[WARNING] templates/: directory not found

==> Skipping /tmp/broken_chart_2
No chart found for linting (missing Chart.yaml)

Error: 1 chart(s) linted, 2 chart(s) failed
```
